page.title: 07POPULATION 2 BISHOP THORNTON
page.content: Another reason for the decline in the population is that some of the farm houses have been sold and the land has been joined to a neighbouring farm and with increased mechanisation fewer farmworkers are needed. There is also a lack of housing in this area. Two years ago 10 houses were built in this village costing from Â£31.000 to Â£88.000 for the four bedroomed house. They were built from old stone salvaged from an old mill and the cavity walls have been insulated to conserve the heat. We are short of some low priced houses for newly married couples and this might also bring more children to our village school.
